result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Martin Weyand

records.addlTxt: NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Ward.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE is starting treatment. STC set to 12/22/22 at 8:30.

Defendant, Joshua Martin Weyand, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Ward. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause is not found on Ct 1 and does not bind over on that charge and dismisses charge without prejudice.    Ct 2  only-  Not guilty pleas entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol - only for employment.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

01:01 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Berman for John Anthony Ward.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set for July 13, 2022 at 09:15 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). DE waives time for the Preliminary hearing. rb
